list_definition.definition: a male servant wearing a uniform

list_ex_of_english: Foot racing competitions evolved from wagers between aristocrats, who pitted their footman against that of another aristocrat in order to determine a winner.
Instead, they received hot meals, brought by royal footman, from the castle kitchens.
A footman came in, and the old man ordered bread and butter for his wife.
He related that footmen in legions and horsemen in squadrons gathered round him to demand reductions of rent.
Someone mentioned the footman living over the garage.
The footman had been passed unfit for general service and for sedentary work at home only.
A footman living above a garage or in a house would be resident, but someone living in a lodge—it may be two or three miles away—would not be resident.
I think he must be referring to the question of airmen dressed as footmen.
